player: Mike Muscala (ankle) will not play on Monday vs. the Clippers.
Tiago Splitter (calf) will not play on Monday vs. the Clippers.
Caris LeVert will be rested for Monday's game against the Spurs.
Joe Harris (left ankle) will not play Monday vs. the Spurs.
The Nets announced that Jeremy Lin will miss another 3-5 weeks after aggravating his strained left hamstring.
Demetrius Jackson (illness) will not play on Tuesday vs. the Wizards.
Gerald Green (illness) will not play on Tuesday vs. the Wizards.
Jonas Jerebko (illness) will be available to play on Tuesday vs. the Wizards.
Avery Bradley (Achilles) will miss all four games this week.
James Young (ankle) is available to play on Saturday against the Blazers.
Tyler Zeller (illness) will be available to play on Tuesday vs. the Wizards.
Brian Roberts (illness) will not suit up for Monday's game against the Wizards.
Jeremy Lamb (foot) will not play on Saturday against the Nets.
J.R. Smith hasn't done any cardio exercises since fracturing his thumb on Dec. 20, but hopes to receive clearance to begin working out at his doctor's appointment on Friday.
Chris Anderson suffered a torn ACL in his right knee and will be out for the rest of the season.
Wesley Matthews (right hip strain) is expected to play vs. the Knicks on Wednesday, according to coach Rick Carlisle.
J.J. Barea (left calf strain) is likely out until the All-Star break according to coach Rick Carlisle.
Andrew Bogut (hamstring) could be cleared to play later this week.
Coach Mike Malone said that Emmanuel Mudiay (back) is "very doubtful" to play Tuesday vs. the Jazz.
Michael Gbinije (right forearm bruise) is listed as doubtful for Friday's game vs. Utah.
Andre Iguodala will be rested on Monday vs. the Heat.
David West has been diagnosed with a non-displaced fracture in his left thumb, and he will be reevaluated in two weeks.
Monta Ellis sprained his right ankle in Monday's loss to the Knicks, finishing with six points on 1-of-6 shooting with three rebounds, three assists and two turnovers in 24 minutes.
Aaron Brooks (sore right knee) will not suit up for Monday's game against the Knicks.
Rodney Stuckey (hamstring) will not play on Monday vs. the Knicks.
Chris Paul underwent successful surgery on Wednesday to repair a torn ligament in his left thumb, and he's expected to miss the next 6-8 weeks of action.
Blake Griffin (knee) is listed as probable for Tuesday's game vs. the 76ers.
Brice Johnson (back) is nearing a return according to coach Doc Rivers.
D'Angelo Russell said that his strained left calf is giving him more pain than the mildly sprained right knee, but he doesn't believe either ailments are all that serious.
Troy Daniels (knee) will not play on Saturday against the Rockets due to a Grade 1 MCL sprain.
Brandan Wright (left ankle surgery) was a full participant during Monday's practice.
Tyler Johnson will not travel with the Heat for Wednesday's game vs. the Nets or on Friday vs. the Bulls.
Josh Richardson (foot) will miss at least the next two weeks of action.
Justise Winslow (right shoulder) had surgery to repair a torn labrum on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
Josh McRoberts (stress reaction in left foot) is out indefinitely, according to coach Erik Spoelstra.
Updating a previous item, Ricky Rubio (personal/hip) says he's recovered from the hip injury that kept him out of the second half of last Thursday's game and is ready to play Tuesday vs. the Suns.
Nikola Pekovic hinted that he may retire from the game of basketball.
Khris Middleton (hamstring) has been aiming for a return near the All-Star break, according to C.F. Gardner of the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel.
Anthony Davis (quad) practiced on Tuesday and said he's expecting to play Wednesday against the Thunder.
Quincy Pondexter underwent successful arthroscopic left knee surgery on Wednesday morning.
Lance Thomas (orbital fracture) will miss at least the next week of action.
The MRI results on D.J. Augustin's sprained right ankle came back clean, and he's expected to be listed as day-to-day moving forward.
Jodie Meeks (right thumb) will not need surgery and is expected to miss 4-6 weeks.
Evan Fournier (heel) did not practice on Monday.
Jahlil Okafor (knee) was limited in shootaround on Tuesday morning and has been downgraded to questionable for Tuesday's game vs. the Clippers.
Joel Embiid (left knee bruise) is expected to play Friday vs. the Rockets.
Jerryd Bayless (left wrist) had surgery on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
Ben Simmons (foot) had a planned scan on Monday with his operating physician in New York and is progressing as expected, yet remains without a timetable for his return.
Dragan Bender (right ankle soreness) is listed as questionable for Tuesday's game vs. the Timberwolves.
Jared Dudley (illness) is expected to be available against the Cavs on Thursday.
Ed Davis (ankle) is out for Saturday against the Celtics.
Festus Ezeli (knee) will not be with the Blazers on their four-game trip, but his agent says it is
because of an impending knee surgery.
Kawhi Leonard (hand, Nets) will not play on Monday vs. the Nets.
Manu Ginobili (back spasms) is listed as probable for Tuesday's game vs. the Raptors.
Tony Parker (foot) has been ruled out of Tuesday's game vs. the Raptors.
Pau Gasol (left hand) is undergoing surgery to repair the fracture of his fourth metacarpal.
Rudy Gay will undergo surgery to repair his ruptured left Achilles tendon on Monday.
Omri Casspi will miss the next 1-2 weeks of action with a right calf injury.
DeMar DeRozan (ankle) will miss the next two games for the Raptors.
Patrick Patterson (sore left knee) has been upgraded to probable for Tuesday's game vs. the Spurs.
Delon Wright is active to face the Hornets on Friday.
Rodney Hood (knee) will not play Tuesday vs. the Nuggets.
Scott Brooks said that Ian Mahinmi (knees) will be re-evaluated at the end of January.
Danuel House (fractured right wrist) will be re-evaluated in 10 days.
